alternatives.transcript: Hi, I'm Jacques Pepin and I'm cooking at home. I love hamburger. For the regular hamburger, I bought 4 ounces too. But I always have a hard time, you know, and I have a big mouth putting that in my mouth. So I'm going to do it a bit differently for you today. Those 4 ounce hamburger are going to become 2 ounces hamburger. And I'm going to do that on English muffin. I love English muffin, especially when they are well brown, you know? So here I have my 2 hamburger divided into 4 now. A little bit of salt on top of it. Yeah, a bit of oil, just a bit. And that's it. They're ready to go on the grill outside or here. Here we are. And then English muffin in the toaster. Probably going to toast them twice because I like them really nice and brown. And of course, tomato. And since I'm going to have 4 of burger, I need 4 little slice of tomato. Just like this. I think I'll put a little bit of pepper on top of this. And of course you can cook them the way you want. I like them pink inside, slightly pink. Some people should say You should have them well done. This is purely a question of taste. Now, I have my, well about a Minute and a half, maybe 2 minutes on each side. My wife like a burger with mayonnaise on top. I like mine with ketchup. And of course there is all kind of variation you can do. You can put a little bit of cheese now on top of it to let it brown. I think they're about cooking up for me. My muffins are here. Ooh, they're hot. I'm putting, of course, a little bit of lettuce on top of it. You can have this. I want nice things of lettuce. I even like iceberg on this, you know, which is crunchy and all that, but any salad will do. Then I put the sweet onion. Of course, finally your slice of tomato on each of this. Here, I like to put a dash of salt on my tomato here. And finally, the burger will go right on top here. It looks more like 1 burger, but it is actually a 4 ounce burger, which is done now in 4 half. And on top of this for me, I want a little bit of ketchup. All right. And for my wife, Gloria, like a little bit of mayonnaise on top. That's it. And this is the way I like my hamburger. And even this, I think I can make it this way. It's good enough for me. Happy cooking. Delicious. ♪♪

paragraphs.transcript:
Hi, I'm Jacques Pepin and I'm cooking at home. I love hamburger. For the regular hamburger, I bought 4 ounces too. But I always have a hard time, you know, and I have a big mouth putting that in my mouth. So I'm going to do it a bit differently for you today.

Those 4 ounce hamburger are going to become 2 ounces hamburger. And I'm going to do that on English muffin. I love English muffin, especially when they are well brown, you know? So here I have my 2 hamburger divided into 4 now. A little bit of salt on top of it.

Yeah, a bit of oil, just a bit. And that's it. They're ready to go on the grill outside or here. Here we are. And then English muffin in the toaster.

Probably going to toast them twice because I like them really nice and brown. And of course, tomato. And since I'm going to have 4 of burger, I need 4 little slice of tomato. Just like this. I think I'll put a little bit of pepper on top of this.

And of course you can cook them the way you want. I like them pink inside, slightly pink. Some people should say You should have them well done. This is purely a question of taste. Now, I have my, well about a Minute and a half, maybe 2 minutes on each side.

My wife like a burger with mayonnaise on top. I like mine with ketchup. And of course there is all kind of variation you can do. You can put a little bit of cheese now on top of it to let it brown. I think they're about cooking up for me.

My muffins are here. Ooh, they're hot. I'm putting, of course, a little bit of lettuce on top of it. You can have this. I want nice things of lettuce.

I even like iceberg on this, you know, which is crunchy and all that, but any salad will do. Then I put the sweet onion. Of course, finally your slice of tomato on each of this. Here, I like to put a dash of salt on my tomato here. And finally, the burger will go right on top here.

It looks more like 1 burger, but it is actually a 4 ounce burger, which is done now in 4 half. And on top of this for me, I want a little bit of ketchup. All right. And for my wife, Gloria, like a little bit of mayonnaise on top. That's it.

And this is the way I like my hamburger. And even this, I think I can make it this way. It's good enough for me. Happy cooking. Delicious.

♪♪

sentences.text: Hi, I'm Jacques Pepin and I'm cooking at home.
I love hamburger.
For the regular hamburger, I bought 4 ounces too.
But I always have a hard time, you know, and I have a big mouth putting that in my mouth.
So I'm going to do it a bit differently for you today.
Those 4 ounce hamburger are going to become 2 ounces hamburger.
And I'm going to do that on English muffin.
I love English muffin, especially when they are well brown, you know?
So here I have my 2 hamburger divided into 4 now.
A little bit of salt on top of it.
Yeah, a bit of oil, just a bit.
And that's it.
They're ready to go on the grill outside or here.
Here we are.
And then English muffin in the toaster.
Probably going to toast them twice because I like them really nice and brown.
And of course, tomato.
And since I'm going to have 4 of burger, I need 4 little slice of tomato.
Just like this.
I think I'll put a little bit of pepper on top of this.
And of course you can cook them the way you want.
I like them pink inside, slightly pink.
Some people should say You should have them well done.
This is purely a question of taste.
Now, I have my, well about a Minute and a half, maybe 2 minutes on each side.
My wife like a burger with mayonnaise on top.
I like mine with ketchup.
And of course there is all kind of variation you can do.
You can put a little bit of cheese now on top of it to let it brown.
I think they're about cooking up for me.
My muffins are here.
Ooh, they're hot.
I'm putting, of course, a little bit of lettuce on top of it.
You can have this.
I want nice things of lettuce.
I even like iceberg on this, you know, which is crunchy and all that, but any salad will do.
Then I put the sweet onion.
Of course, finally your slice of tomato on each of this.
Here, I like to put a dash of salt on my tomato here.
And finally, the burger will go right on top here.
It looks more like 1 burger, but it is actually a 4 ounce burger, which is done now in 4 half.
And on top of this for me, I want a little bit of ketchup.
All right.
And for my wife, Gloria, like a little bit of mayonnaise on top.
That's it.
And this is the way I like my hamburger.
And even this, I think I can make it this way.
It's good enough for me.
Happy cooking.
Delicious.
